intro: Biscutella mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritania biscuit flower, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and has a deep root system to access water. Biscutella mauritanica is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
